title: Blow to offshore wind hopes as Origin puts $8b project on hold
snippet: Uncertainty over the economic and political viability of the industry is forcing key renewable energy investors to reconsider their near-term priorities.

title: ASX to rise, Wall St resets records on benign inflation
snippet: Australian shares are set to catch New York’s optimistic outlook wave; Dow tops 46,000 for first time in broad rally; commodities ease. Follow live.

title: FBI releases photo of ‘person of interest’ in Charlie Kirk killing
snippet: The FBI also said it is offering a reward of up to $150,000 for information leading to the arrest of the individual(s) responsible for the murder of Kirk.

title: Lawsuit alleges 16-hour days, bullying at MCo Beauty dupes empire
snippet: The cosmetics producer’s former head of finance claims he was “pretty much destroyed” working on a deal to sell the business to billionaire Dennis Bastas.

title: Super funds scale back foreign currency risk, driving $A higher
snippet: The superannuation industry is increasingly worried that a stronger dollar will eat into funds’ investment returns.

title: Julie Bishop digs in as ANU vice chancellor Genevieve Bell resigns
snippet: ANU chancellor Julie Bishop told a packed town hall of the resignation of vice chancellor Genevieve Bell. Now she is defending her own position.

title: The rise of the CommSec warriors
snippet: Retail investors may not get one-on-one meetings or sway AGM votes on their own, but they’ve emerged as friendly high-conviction buyers.

title: From Silicon Valley to ANU: How Genevieve Bell’s story hit a wall
snippet: She was the “feral kid from Australia” who went to Stanford and Intel; the rock-star scientist who took charge of ANU. Less than two years later, she’s gone.

title: Police recover high-powered rifle used in Charlie Kirk assassination
snippet: A major police manhunt was underway for the lone shooter of the right-wing activist, as Donald Trump called the killing a “dark moment for America”.

title: Sussan Ley would rather die on her feet than live on her knees
snippet: Whether it’s staring down the Nationals or taking on Jacinta Price, the opposition leader has demonstrated that she’s not going to die wondering.

title: Register reveals the price of a lunch with a Labor minister
snippet: Workers compensation and gig economy stakeholders paid NSW Labor to meet Treasurer Daniel Mookhey and Industrial Relations Minister Sophie Cotsis.

title: Major builder joins call for royal commission into Vic rorts claims
snippet: A senior building executive and Liberal oppositions have called for a broader inquiry into what the Allan government knew about rorting and kickbacks.

title: Mayne Pharma says suitor’s plan to close factory is ‘not credible’
snippet: The ASX-listed healthcare business is trying to force its buyer to close on a $672 million deal, but the future of a plant in Adelaide is a major roadblock.

title: Real estate war goes nuclear as Lendlease advises Mirvac vote boycott
snippet: The suggestion was criticised as “inappropriate” and “bad governance” by advisers to investors who want to evict the group from managing the $10 billion empire.

title: Downer EDI, Ventia win defence contracts despite price-fixing charges
snippet: Shares in the contractors rose on Thursday after both companies confirmed they had been successful in renewing contracts.

title: ART’s higher risk default super savings plan is paying off, for now
snippet: The country’s second-largest retirement savings fund switched members under 50 to a high-growth strategy last year. It’s boosted returns by 1 percentage point.

title: RBA acknowledges widespread criticism of payment fee plan
snippet: The central bank said it had taken on board feedback about planned changes to interchange fees after many small business owners said they would be worse off.

title: How the Qantas frequent flyer program compares to others for value
snippet: The airline lifted its rank in an annual survey after improvements, but still offers poor rewards compared to leaders such as Air France and British Airways.

title: Di Pilla’s DigiCo hires ex-AirTrunk boss as data centre race heats up
snippet: HMC Capital’s David Di Pilla has hired former AirTrunk executive Michael Juniper to help lift the performance of its data centre group REIT DigiCo.

title: US core consumer prices rise as expected, paving way for rate cut
snippet: The core consumer price index, excluding food and energy, increased 0.3 per cent from July. The overall CPI rose 0.4pc, the most since the start of the year.

title: Small-cap fund says market blind to one of ASX’s ‘best bargains’
snippet: Investors Mutual’s portfolio manager Lucas Goode names two small-cap stocks that could be ripe for a re-rating.

title: Klarna’s big stock debut shows BNPL is over its existential crisis
snippet: For Afterpay co-founder and sector pioneer Nick Molnar, the IPO is a strong endorsement of his wildly popular pay-in-four model.

title: Double down or dump? Here’s how fundies traded the earnings season
snippet: After the most volatile results period on record for the ASX, here’s what fund managers from Airlie to Wilson Asset Management bought and sold last month.

title: Lithium stocks dumped as China giant restarts mine
snippet: Pilbara Minerals and Liontown Resources have dived 5 per cent on news that Chinese battery giant CATL will restart production at its Jianxiawo mine.

title: Kirk’s death expected to galvanise Australian protests
snippet: The assassination of the US political activist is being mourned in Australia by groups that are set to stage major protests this weekend.

title: China tried to crash this summit, even though it wasn’t invited
snippet: China was uninvited from the Pacific Islands Forum in Solomon Islands but its influence is hard to ignore, from Facebook posts to a lavish stadium and flashy SUVs.

title: Police say home attack targeted Jewish leader
snippet: NSW Police believe the antisemitic slogans that were painted across a home in Sydney’s Dover Heights were aimed at Alex Ryvchin, who used to live there.

title: Leaked files show Victoria’s Big Build went bad years ago
snippet: A former anti-corruption commissioner has backed a royal commission-style inquiry into evidence the Allan government knew about complaints of rorting.

title: ‘Doesn’t reflect modern Australia’: Ley dumps Price from frontbench
snippet: The move comes as a new poll shows growing voter concern over migration, the issue that triggered the high-profile Liberal party stoush.

title: Epstein ties dethrone ‘prince of darkness’ Peter Mandelson
snippet: The British ambassador to the US is the latest casualty in the Epstein files and his firing is another headache for embattled PM Keir Starmer.

title: How Tokyo became an unexpected haven for China’s middle class
snippet: Forget the United States. A whole industry has sprung up around aspirational want-aways escaping to the greener grass of Japan.

title: The Pushkin heist: how crime gangs targeted rare books
snippet: Almost 200 valuable Russian classics have gone missing from libraries across Europe. Some suspect it is a “special operation” co-ordinated by the Kremlin.

title: The terrifying reality of US political violence just got darker
snippet: Charlie Kirk’s murder was the second fatal act of political violence this year. But his assassination while promoting free speech reveals a new depth of polarisation.

title: ‘This was a rehearsal’: Why Putin’s Poland incursion has alarmed NATO
snippet: The incursion into Polish airspace by Russian drones marks a dangerous new chapter in the Ukraine conflict. Is Western Europe ready for this?

title: Hotelier Jerry Schwartz adds new Sydney brewery to the mix
snippet: The former Rich Lister has taken over the White Bay Brewery in Rozelle, and hopes to expand into other beverage markets, including canned water.

title: Harry Triguboff sends discounted Gold Coast penthouse to auction
snippet: “High Rise Harry” is putting his Main Beach holiday pad – complete with indoor pool – on the block after previous attempts to sell it.

title: Uluru’s only resort set to land new private equity-backed owner
snippet: Journey Beyond, the owner of The Ghan and Indian Pacific trains, is in exclusive negotiations to buy the asset that sprawls across the desert near the landmark.

title: Sydney’s 55-storey timber Halo tower back on track
snippet: The involvement of Cbus Property in the ambitious project secures the future for one of city’s most high-profile but challenged developments.

title: Chemist Warehouse founder snaps up Toorak mansion for $20m-plus
snippet: Mario Verrocchi has added to his property portfolio by splashing out in one of Melbourne’s most prestigious suburbs following the pharmacy giant’s ASX listing.

title: Is your male CEO sacking everyone? He may be in financial crisis
snippet: Why some male corporate leaders and billionaires may need financial therapy more than anyone.

title: My wife is getting my super and insurance. What are her options?
snippet: Superannuation law requires that death benefits be dealt with as soon as practicable after somebody passes away.

title: How the rich are using alternatives to future-proof their fortunes
snippet: As Australia becomes more exposed to global risks, the traditional twin pillars of wealth – real estate and equities – no longer feel sufficient on their own.

title: Nvidia joins $1.5b capital raise for Brisbane start-up
snippet: PsiQuantum, which is racing to build the world’s first quantum computer, has seen its valuation soar to $US7 billion.

title: From memes to job cuts: Corporate Australia cannot hide from Reddit
snippet: If you’re keeping an eye on business social media forums, you won’t have been blindsided by the latest rounds of banking redundancies.

title: The No.1 rule for stopping phones taking over your kids’ lives
snippet: Chief among researcher Jean Twenge’s rules: No smartphone until you get your driver’s license. And no social media until you turn 16.

title: The rise and rise of Mark Ricciuto
snippet: He was part of the Adelaide Crows’ last premiership before becoming an off-field powerbroker during the club’s years in the wilderness.

title: How a lawyer, accountant and 10 others are using AI at work
snippet: Everyone is using AI, from chartered accountants to chemistry professors, celebrity chefs, vice chancellors, dentists, teachers and real estate agents.

title: Petrified trees and recycled plastic: The best of Bali’s design fest
snippet: The fourth annual Jia Curated proves that contemporary design on the Indonesian island is thriving.

title: My crazy New York night out with Charlie Sheen
snippet: As the Two and Half Men actor releases a tell-all memoir and Netflix documentary, a writer recalls a chaotic day in Charlie World trying to nail an interview.

title: The wacky luxury timepieces inspired by a watchmaker’s hangover
snippet: Franck Muller’s renegade energy and penchant for whimsy survives in his creations.

title: Can’t stand crowds? Visit this underrated historic European city
snippet: Càdiz is known for its rich history, carnival celebrations, fresh seafood dishes and stunning coastline.
